title: Rylan Clark-Neal awkwardly gets Strictly's Saffron Barker's name wrong
text:
It could only happen to Rylan (Picture: BBC)

Rylan Clark-Neal got his words mixed up live on TV after he accidentally called Saffron Barker…Scarlett (oops).

The host was interviewing guests, Scarlett Moffatt, Ruth Langsford and Rustie-Lee on Strictly Come Dancing’s sister show It Takes Two – although poor Rylan had a bit of a blunder.

Rylan was talking to his Friday panel about AJ Pritchard and Saffron Barker, who is currently competing on the show.

When he was about to show them a clip of their rehearsal he said: ‘They have all be in rehearsals this week and we need to talk about Scarlett and AJ.’

‘Scarlett and AJ,’ he repeated.

Scarlett responded: ‘That’s the dream, that’s the dream right there.’

Scarlett took it in good grace (Picture: BBC)

Rylan realised his mistake and then let slip a ‘spoiler alert’.

He added: ‘Spoiler alert for 2020.

Advertisement

Advertisement

‘Saffron and AJ are going to be doing the jive.’

The panel also got to vote for who they think will be eliminated this weekend.

It was a unanimous decision and all three predicted that Mike Bushell and Katya Jones would be booted from the show.

We would love to see Scarlett Moffatt compete on Strictly next year…so you heard it here first (kind of)

You can catch Strictly: It Takes Two weekdays on BBC One.

description: Rylan Clark-Neal's blunder as he gets Scarlett Moffatt and Saffron Barker mixed up on Strictly: It Takes Two.
